WW.Actor.Name: Actor's Name
WW.Actor.ProfileMenuTip:
Clique-esquerdo para editar o retrato.
Clique-direito para mostrar o retrato/token.
WW.Actor.Disposition.Tip:
Click to toggle disposition between Ally (friendly) and Enemy (hostile).

In Shadow of the Weird Wizard, a creature is either an enemy or an ally for the purpose of combat.

Foundry's neutral disposition should not be used. Use Enemy (hostile) for unaligned creatures or Ally (friendly) if they are actively helping the characters.

Foundry's secret disposition should be used wisely. You should switch the disposition to Enemy or Ally before combat begins.
WW.Actor.Folder.None: A criatura não está em uma pasta. Para ter uma descrição da pasta, coloque-a primeiro em uma pasta.
WW.Attributes.Label: Atributos
WW.Attributes.EditHint: You are editing the base attribute score, without any effect modifying it. The modified score should be {value}.
WW.Stats.Label: Stats
WW.Stats.AutomationHint: Para alterar, adicione uma Ancestralidade, Trilha e/ou efeito que modifique o cálculo.
WW.Defense.Label: Defesa
WW.Defense.NaturalDisabled:
To edit the base Natural Defense manually, please toggle off any effects that increase or reduce it, such armor or a shield.

You can reenable the effects once you're done editing.
WW.Health.Label: Vida
WW.Health.NormalHint: A Vida Normal está definida como 0 porque nenhuma Trilha, Ancestralidade ou efeito a está alterando. Adicione um ou mais desses elementos com um efeito que altere o valor da Vida Normal.
WW.Health.CurrentHint: You can only edit your current Health manually if no temporary Health bonuses are active.
WW.Health.TemporaryHint: This segment represents a temporary Health bonus. When the temporary Health expires, if your damage exceeds your new Health, you'll become incapacitated.
WW.Damage.Label: Dano
WW.Rest.Label: Repouso
WW.Rest.Msg: O repouso permite curar dano e recuperar recursos gastos. Se você tiver um tempo de repouso ininterrupto de 6 horas consecutivas, cura todo o seu dano e recupera Vida igual a um décimo da sua Vida normal. Alguns outros recursos, tais como feitiços ou talentos, também podem ser recuperados depois de um repouso. Se você parar de repousar para usar uma ação ou reação, o tempo de repouso até esse momento é perdido e você deve recomeçar para receber qualquer benefício.
WW.Reset.Label: Reset Sheet to Original Values
WW.Reset.Msg: This action will reset the following parameters to their original values: total Damage, Health, talent/trait uses and spell castings.
WW.Reset.Confirm: Do you really want to reset the sheet?
WW.ListEntry.Descriptor.Label: Descritores
WW.ListEntry.Sense.Label: Sentidos
WW.ListEntry.Language.Label: Idiomas
WW.ListEntry.Immunity.Label: Imunidades
WW.ListEntry.MovementTrait.Label: Forma de Movimento Especial
WW.ListEntry.Connection.Label: Connections
WW.Group.ActorDropWarning: You can only drop Characters, NPCs or Vehicles on the Group sheet.
WW.Group.EquipmentDropWarning: Groups can only store Equipment items, not Traits, Talents or Spells.
WW.Item.Name: Nome
WW.Item.Perform.Left: Clique-esquerdo: Executar ação (se os alvos já estiverem selecionados, utilize-o).
WW.Item.Perform.Shift: Shift + Clique-esquerdo: Selecionar alvos e executar ação.
WW.Item.Perform.Ctrl: Ctrl + Clique-esquerdo: Enviar descrição para o chat.
WW.Item.Create.Label: Add
WW.Item.Remove.Label: Excluir
WW.Item.Remove.Dialog.Title: Remove Item
WW.Item.Remove.Dialog.Msg: You are about to delete {name}. This action is irreversible.
WW.Item.Remove.Dialog.Confirm: Are you sure you want to delete {name}?
WW.Item.Uses.LevelRelative: O número de usos/cargas/fichas/conjurações é proporcional ao nível do personagem?
WW.Roll.Label: Rolar
WW.Roll.TargetNumberHint:
If a custom target number is set, the attribute or luck will be rolled against it.

If unset, it will try to roll against the target number from targeted tokens.

If unable to, it will instead roll against the default target number for the game, 10.
WW.Roll.AgainstWrn: Nothing selected to roll against. Please select Defense or an attribute to roll against in the Weapon's Automation & Effects tab.
WW.Roll.FlatHint: This number will be added to the total roll sum, regardless if there an attribute modifier exists or not.
WW.Boons.Situational: Adjust the number of situational Boons/Banes
WW.Targeting.Label: Escolher Alvo
WW.Targeting.Dialog.SelectTargets: Please select one or more tokens to target.
WW.RollDamage.BrutalHint: This weapon has the Brutal trait, so every result of 1 is rerolled, as represented by the r1 in the formula next to each pool of dice.
WW.RollDamage.Bonus.Hint: The amount of Bonus Damage dice to be applied to the attack.
WW.RollDamage.Bonus.Increase: Increase the number of Bonus Damage dice applied.
WW.RollDamage.Bonus.IncreaseShift: Click while holding Shift to add the maximum Bonus Damage amount.
WW.RollDamage.Bonus.Reduce: Reduce the number of Bonus Damage dice applied.
WW.RollDamage.Bonus.ReduceShift: Click while holding Shift to not use any Bonus Damage dice.
WW.RollDamage.Extra.Label: Extra Damage
WW.RollDamage.Extra.AttackDice: Extra Damage dice for all attacks
WW.RollDamage.Extra.AttackMod: Extra Damage modifier for all attacks
WW.RollDamage.Extra.OtherDiceHint: Add a custom amount of dice from any other sources as Extra Damage.
WW.RollDamage.Extra.OtherModHint: Add a custom flat modifier from any other sources as Extra Damage.
WW.Talents.Label: Traços & Talentos
WW.Talent.MagicalHint: Certos Traços ou Talentos produzem efeitos mágicos, e isso é indicado com (Mágico) em suas respectivas descrições.
WW.Talent.Source.Label: Fonte
WW.Spells.Label: Feitiços
WW.Spell.Label: Feitiço
WW.Equipment.Label: Equipamento
WW.Equipment.Availability.Label: Disponibilidade
WW.Equipment.Quality.Label: Qualidade
WW.Container.Label: Container
WW.Container.CapacityHint: The maximum amount of items this container can hold.
WW.Container.FilledHint: Container is holding {filled} items. Maximum capacity is {capacity}.
WW.Armor.Label: Armadura
WW.Attack.RiderPH: **20+:** The target takes an extra 1d6 damage.
WW.Weapon.Label: Arma
WW.Weapon.Fire: Click to fire the loaded weapon.
WW.Weapon.Grip.Label: Manuseio
WW.Weapon.Requirement.Label: Requisitos
WW.Weapon.Traits.Label: Traços
WW.Weapon.Traits.Title: Traços de Armas
WW.Weapon.Traits.Ammunition.Label: Munição
WW.Weapon.Traits.Ammunition.Tip: Você deve ter ao menos uma unidade de munição do tipo indicado para atacar com esta arma. A munição e o recipiente para guardá-la (como uma aljava, estojo ou sacola) estão inclusos no preço da arma. Você pode recuperar munição gasta depois do combate e substituí-la enquanto repousa.
WW.Weapon.Traits.Bludgeoning.Label: Contundente
WW.Weapon.Traits.Bludgeoning.Tip: Quando você atacar com esta arma e tiver um sucesso crítico, o alvo fica vulnerável até o final do seu próximo turno.
WW.Weapon.Traits.Brutal.Label: Brutal
WW.Weapon.Traits.Brutal.Tip: Quando rolar o dano de um ataque usando esta arma, você pode rerrolar uma vez cada dado que resultar em 1. Você deve usar o novo número rolado, mesmo que seja outro 1.
WW.Weapon.Traits.Disarming.Label: Desarmadora
WW.Weapon.Traits.Disarming.Tip: Você ignora o revés imposto à sua rolagem quando usar esta arma para desarmar.
WW.Weapon.Traits.Firearm.Label: Arma de Fogo
WW.Weapon.Traits.Firearm.Tip: Ataques feitos com esta arma fazem um estrondo. Se a arma for imersa em água, você deve secá-la completamente antes de poder fazer ataques à distância com ela. Limpar a arma leva 1 hora de trabalho usando um conjunto de ferramentas e meio litro de óleo. Recarregar a arma leva 1 minuto. Se você fizer alguma outra coisa nesse período, você deve recomeçar desde o início.
WW.Weapon.Traits.Large.Label: Grande
WW.Weapon.Traits.Large.Tip: Sua rolagem de ataque com esta arma enquanto estiver se espremendo ou enquanto estiver montado resulta em um fracasso automático.
WW.Weapon.Traits.Light.Label: Leve
WW.Weapon.Traits.Light.Tip: Quando você adicionar Bônus de Dano a um ataque feito usando esta arma, você adiciona um dado a menos (mínimo +1d6).
WW.Weapon.Traits.Long.Label: Longa
WW.Weapon.Traits.Long.Tip: Quando você atacar com esta arma, aumente o seu alcance em 1 para o propósito de escolher alvos.
WW.Weapon.Traits.Misfire.Label: Falha
WW.Weapon.Traits.Misfire.Tip: Quando você tiver um fracasso crítico em um ataque com esta arma, a arma tem uma falha de disparo. Faça uma rolagem de sorte. Em um sucesso, você precisa apenas recarregar a arma antes de poder atacar novamente com ela. Em um fracasso, a arma fica arruinada até ser consertada, o que leva 1 hora e exige um conjunto de ferramentas e partes sobressalentes cujo valor é igual a metade do preço de venda da arma.
WW.Weapon.Traits.Nimble.Label: Ágil
WW.Weapon.Traits.Nimble.Tip: Quando você ataca com esta arma, você pode usar Agilidade no lugar de Força na rolagem.
WW.Weapon.Traits.Piercing.Label: Perfurante
WW.Weapon.Traits.Piercing.Tip: Quando você atacar com esta arma e tiver um sucesso crítico, o alvo fica enfraquecido até o final do seu próximo turno.
WW.Weapon.Traits.Range.Label: Distância
WW.Weapon.Traits.Range.Tip: Você seleciona o alvo dos seus ataques à distância com esta arma dentre aqueles a até o número de metros listado.
WW.Weapon.Traits.Reload.Label: Recarga
WW.Weapon.Traits.Reload.Tip: Você deve recarregar esta arma antes de poder fazer ataques à distância com ela. Você pode usar uma ação para recarregar a arma ou, se for capaz de se mover e tiver uma Velocidade de 2 ou maior, pode trocar seu movimento para recarregar a arma.
WW.Weapon.Traits.Slashing.Label: Cortante
WW.Weapon.Traits.Slashing.Tip: Quando você atacar com esta arma e tiver um sucesso crítico, o alvo sofre 1d6 de dano extra.
WW.Weapon.Traits.Slow.Label: Lenta
WW.Weapon.Traits.Slow.Tip: Você pode atacar com esta arma somente uma vez por rodada.
WW.Weapon.Traits.Special.Label: Especial
WW.Weapon.Traits.Special.Tip: Esta arma tem regras especiais detalhadas na sua descrição.
WW.Weapon.Traits.Thrown.Label: Arremesso
WW.Weapon.Traits.Thrown.Tip: Você pode fazer um ataque à distância com esta arma ao arremessá-la. Você usa Força para a rolagem, a não ser que a arma também tenha o traço Ágil. Você escolhe o seu alvo dentre aqueles a até o número de metros listado. Se o ataque for bem-sucedido, a arma ou se crava no corpo do alvo, ou cai aos seus pés. Se o ataque resultar em um fracasso, a arma aterrissa 1d6 metros atrás do alvo.
WW.Weapon.Traits.Versatile.Label: Versátil
WW.Weapon.Traits.Versatile.Tip: Quando você empunhar esta arma com ambas as mãos, o dano da arma aumenta em 1d6.
WW.CharOptions.Label: Character Options (BROKEN)
WW.CharOptions.JournalEntryWarning: You are trying to drag and drop a Journal Entry. If you wanted to drag a Character Option, make sure to drag a PAGE from the Journal Entry's hierarchy!
WW.CharOption.DropHere: Drop Equipment, Traits, Talents and Spells stored in a Compendium here to add them to the level benefit.
WW.CharOption.MissingRef: Missing UUID reference for the equipment, trait, talent or spell. You can either delete this entry or restore it by putting the item back in the original Compendium.
WW.CharOption.TypeWarning: Dropped item type must be one of the following: Equipment, Trait/Talent or Spell.
WW.CharOption.CompendiumWarning: Item must be dragged from a Compendium.
WW.CharOption.Help: For more information about character options, click on Help at the top right of the window.
WW.CharOption.Reference.EditRef: Edit the referenced item in the Compendium.
WW.CharOption.Reference.RemoveRef: Remove reference from this list. This won't affect the item in the Compendium!
WW.CharOption.Reference.RemoveDialog.Msg: You are about to remove a reference for an item in a Compendium. Removing the reference will not make any changes the referenced item.
WW.CharOption.Reference.RemoveDialog.Con: Are you sure you want to remove the reference?
WW.CharOption.Reference.ReplaceDialog.Ms:
This character already has {old} registered as a {type}.
Are you sure you want to replace it with {new}?
WW.Profession.Label: Profession
WW.Tradition.Label: Tradições
WW.Tradition.EquipmentWarning:
Traditions cannot record Equipment items.
Please drag and drop a Talent or Spell.
WW.Effects.Label: Efeitos
WW.Effect.HandledByItem: This effect is handled by the item indicated in the Source column. If you want to edit it, please check the item sheet instead.
WW.Effect.HandledByCharOption: Este efeito é um benefício gerenciado por uma opção de personagem. Se desejar editá-lo, edite a opção de personagem em vez do próprio efeito.
WW.Effect.Duration.Label: Effect Duration
WW.Effect.Duration.Combat.2Rounds: Until the end of the next round
WW.Effect.Duration.Combat.TurnEnd: Until the end of the trigger's turn
WW.Effect.Duration.Combat.NextTriggerTur: Until the start of the trigger's next turn
WW.Effect.Duration.Combat.NextTargetTurn: Until the start of the target's next turn
WW.Effect.Duration.Combat.NextTriggerTur: Until the end of the trigger's next turn
WW.Effect.Duration.Combat.NextTargetTurn: Until the end of the target's next turn
WW.Effect.Duration.OutOfCombat.Header: Tracked with Time Units (Out of Combat)
WW.Effect.Keys.Boons.Spells: Boons on rolls for spells you cast +
WW.Effect.Keys.Boons.ResistMagical: Boons on rolls to resist magical effects +
WW.Effect.Keys.Banes.Spells: Banes on rolls for spells you cast +
WW.Effect.Keys.Banes.ResistMagical: Banes on rolls to resist magical effects +
WW.Effect.Keys.BoonsAgainst.Defense: Boons on rolls against your Defense +
WW.Effect.Keys.BoonsAgainst.Strength: Boons on rolls against your Strength +
WW.Effect.Keys.BoonsAgainst.Agility: Boons on rolls against your Agility +
WW.Effect.Keys.BoonsAgainst.Intellect: Boons on rolls against your Intellect +
WW.Effect.Keys.BoonsAgainst.Will: Boons on rolls against your Will +

WW.Effect.Keys.BoonsAgainst.FromSpells: Boons on rolls against you from spells +

WW.Effect.Keys.BanesAgainst.FromSpells: Banes on rolls against you from spells +

WW.Effect.Keys.ExtraDamage.Dice: Increase the number of extra Damage dice by
WW.Effect.Keys.Speed.Override: Speed drops to and cannot be increased above

WW.Effect.Keys.DowngradeAttribute.Header: Set Attribute Score, if not lower
WW.InstantEffect.Label: Efeito Instantâneo
WW.InstantEffect.Roll.Label: Roll
WW.Affliction.Label: Aflições
WW.Affliction.BlindedDesc: Você não consegue enxergar, portanto não tem linha de visão para nada. Você trata todas as criaturas e objetos como estando invisíveis. Se você quiser atacar ou interagir com alguma coisa, deve supor a localização do alvo ou localizá-lo usando outros sentidos, o que geralmente significa que você faz a rolagem com 3 reveses. Você não consegue usar reações que dependam da visão. Por fim, sua Velocidade é reduzida pela metade.
WW.Affliction.ConfusedDesc: Você fica incapaz de compreender o que acontece ao seu redor. Você não pode usar reações e faz rolagens de Intelecto e Vontade com 1 revé.
WW.Affliction.ControlledDesc: Você fica sob o controle da fonte desta aflição. Seu turno acontece junto com o do seu controlador e ele decide o que você faz, usando os seus traços, talentos e feitiços. Se você já tiver feito um turno ao receber esta aflição, você faz um turno como descrito na rodada seguinte. Enquanto controlado, você trata a fonte desta aflição como um aliado.
WW.Affliction.CursedDesc: Você faz rolagens de sorte com 1 revés.
WW.Affliction.DeafenedDesc: Você não consegue ouvir. Você não pode fazer reações que dependam da audição e não é afetado por efeitos que dependam da audição.
WW.Affliction.FrightenedDesc: Você teme a fonte desta aflição — uma criatura, um objeto, um espaço ou alguma outra coisa. Enquanto você tiver linha de visão para a fonte do seu medo, você faz rolagens de atributo com 1 revés e concede 1 dádiva em rolagens de atributo contra você.
WW.Affliction.HeldDesc: A sua Velocidade diminui a 0 e você não se beneficia de aumentos à Velocidade até esta aflição terminar. Além disso, criaturas que fizerem rolagens contra a sua Agilidade recebem um sucesso automático.
WW.Affliction.ImpairedDesc: A aflição debilitado afeta o atributo especificado pelo efeito prejudicial, então você pode, por exemplo, ter sua Força debilitada ou seu Intelecto debilitado. Você rola com 1 revés ao usar o atributo especificado e você concede 1 dádiva em rolagens contra o atributo especificado.
WW.Affliction.OnFireDesc: Um efeito pode fazer você pegar fogo. Você sofre 1d6 de dano ao final de cada rodada até o fogo ser apagado, normalmente com uma rolagem bem-sucedida de sorte. Você pode apagar as chamas com água, ou sufocá-las com um cobertor ou objeto similar. Uma criatura que ficar caída antes de tentar superar as chamas faz a rolagem com 1 dádiva.
WW.Affliction.PoisonedDesc: Você foi submetido a uma peçonha, veneno ou outro tipo de toxina. Você faz rolagens de atributo com 1 revés e concede 1 dádiva em rolagens contra você. Além disso, você perde 1d6 de Vida ao final de cada rodada.
WW.Affliction.ProneDesc: Você está deitado no chão. Você não pode usar reações. Você concede 1 dádiva em rolagens feitas para atacar você com armas corpo a corpo, mas impõe 1 revés em rolagens feitas para atacar você com armas à distância. Você somente pode usar seu movimento para rastejar ou se levantar.
WW.Affliction.SlowedDesc: Se sua Velocidade for maior que 2, ela reduz a 2. Essa aflição não aumenta a Velocidade.
WW.Affliction.StunnedDesc: Você não pode usar ações ou reações. A sua Velocidade diminui a 0 e você não se beneficia de aumentos à Velocidade até esta aflição terminar. Você concede 2 dádivas em rolagens contra você e faz rolagens de atributo com 2 reveses.
WW.Affliction.UnconsciousDesc: Você não pode usar ações ou reações. A sua Velocidade diminui a 0 e você não se beneficia de aumentos à Velocidade. Você não recebe informações sensoriais. Você concede 3 dádivas em rolagens contra você e você fracassa automaticamente em todas as rolagens de atributo.
WW.Affliction.AsleepDesc: Se você estiver inconsciente por estar dormindo naturalmente, você deixa de estar inconsciente quando uma criatura usar uma ação para chacoalhar você, chutá-lo ou fazer outra coisa para acordar você. Um barulho alto pode remover a aflição se você tiver sucesso em uma rolagem de sorte. O tempo passado dormindo conta como repouso para os propósitos de curar dano. Se o seu sono não for interrompido, você acorda naturalmente quando quiser.
WW.Affliction.VulnerableDesc: Você concede 1 dádiva em rolagens para atacar você e em rolagens feitas contra os seus atributos.
WW.Affliction.WeakenedDesc: Você faz rolagens de Força e de Agilidade com 1 revés, e você concede 1 dádiva em rolagens contra sua Força e Agilidade. Além disso, a sua Velocidade é reduzida pela metade e você não se beneficia de aumentos à Velocidade.
WW.Combat.RightClickTip:
Right click for context options.

Drag and drop a combatant within its phase to reorder them.
WW.Combat.Standby:
Combat is on standby because someone is taking their turn.

Please wait until the turn is finished.
WW.Combat.NoPermission:
You lack permission to take turns with this combatant.

If you think you should have control over this creature, please ask your Sage for the Owner permission.
WW.Combat.RegularTurn.Label: Make a Regular Turn
WW.Combat.RegularTurn.ClickTip:
Character is going to take a regular turn next round.

Click to take the initiative instead.
WW.Combat.Initiative.Label: Take the Initiative
WW.Combat.Initiative.ClickTip:
Character is going to take the initiative next round.

Click to take a regular turn instead.
WW.Combat.Initiative.Title: Taking the Initiative
WW.Combat.Initiative.Msg:
A new round started.

Do you want to use a reaction to take the initiative, instead of making a regular turn?
WW.Combat.Initiative.NoCharacter: A new round started, but you don't have a character assigned to you.
WW.Combat.ResetActed.Title: Reset the "Acted" Status
WW.Combat.ResetActed.Msg:
You already took a turn during this round and are marked as "Acted".
Normally, each combatant can take only one turn per round.
WW.Combat.ResetActed.Confirm: Are you sure you want to reset the Acted status?
WW.Combat.StartTurn.Title: Start a Turn
WW.Combat.StartTurn.Msg: You are going to make the combatant you selected take the the next turn.
WW.Combat.End.Title: End of Combat
WW.Combat.End.Msg: You are about to end the combat encounter. Ending it will empty the turn tracker. Are you sure?
WW.Combat.End.Msg2: If yes, do you also want to skip the world time by 1 minute? Doing so will end any ongoing effect that is either tracked by turns or rounds, has (luck Ends) or lasts 1 minute.
WW.Sage.Title: Sage Tools
WW.Sage.Trackers.Time.AdvanceHint:
Action scenes, including combat, are assumed to last 1 minute.

Advancing the world time allows for ongoing effects with a duration under 1 minute to expire.
WW.Sage.Trackers.Combat.Label: Current Combat
WW.Sage.Players.None: No players on the table yet. Invite them!
WW.Settings.Combat.SkipActedHint: Automatically bypass combatants who already acted during this round.
WW.Settings.DamageBarReverseHint: If disabled, damage/health bars start at 0 and fill up as damage increases. If enabled, bars start full and decrease when taking damage.
WW.Settings.Entry.EditWarning: The entry is missing an ID/key and/or a name. Please provide both.
WW.Settings.Entry.RemoveDialog.Msg: Are you sure you want to remove the entry?
WW.Settings.Entry.Name: Nome (Obrigatório)
WW.Settings.Entry.DisplayInstructions:
Passe o mouse sobre um item para ver sua descrição.
Arraste e solte um item na ficha de Personagem/NPC para adicioná-lo.
WW.Settings.Languages.Name: Idiomas Disponíveis para Criaturas
WW.Settings.Languages.Hint: Here you can edit the Languages available to creatures in your world.
WW.Settings.Languages.Label: Edit Languages
WW.Settings.Senses.Name: Senses Available to Creatures
WW.Settings.Senses.Hint: Here you can edit the Senses available to creatures in your world.
WW.Settings.Senses.Label: Edit Senses
WW.Settings.Immunities.Name: Immunities Available to Creatures
WW.Settings.Immunities.Hint: Here you can edit the Immunities available to creatures in your world.
WW.Settings.Immunities.Label: Edit Immunities
WW.Settings.MovementTraits.Name: Formas de Movimento Disponíveis para Criaturas
WW.Settings.MovementTraits.Hint: Here you can edit the Special Movement Traits available to creatures in your world.
WW.Settings.MovementTraits.Label: Edit Movement Traits
WW.Settings.Descriptors.Name: Creature Descriptors Available to Creatures
WW.Settings.Descriptors.Hint: Here you can edit the Descriptors available to creatures in your world.
WW.Settings.Descriptors.Label: Edit Descriptors
WW.Settings.WeaponTraits.Name: Weapon Traits Available
WW.Settings.WeaponTraits.Hint: Here you can edit the Weapon Traits available in your world.
WW.Settings.WeaponTraits.Label: Edit Weapon Traits
WW.Settings.Afflictions.Name: Afflictions Available to Creatures
WW.Settings.Afflictions.Hint: Here you can edit the Afflictions available to creatures in your world.
WW.Settings.Afflictions.Label: Edit Afflictions
WW.Settings.Connections.Name: Connections Available to Groups
WW.Settings.Connections.Hint: Here you can edit the Connections available to the players' group in your world.
WW.Settings.Connections.Label: Edit Connections
WW.System.Welcome:
{intro}

Hail!

Welcome to Shadow of the Weird Wizard.

To get started, have a look at the System Documentation compendium in the Compendium Packs tab.

You can also find tours in the Tour Managegement under settings.
WW.System.WelcomeFooter:
Links to the Patch Notes, known Issues on Github and the Discord community can also be found in the settings tab. Feedback is always welcome!

Have fun and stay weird!
WW.System.CharOptionDrag: Drag the Character Option and drop on a creature sheet to add it to them.
WW.System.Migration.Started: Outdated data found. Please wait until the data migration is finished.
WW.System.Migration.Forced: Forced data migration started. Please wait until the data migration is finished.
WW.System.Migration.Finished: Data migration successful. Enjoy your game!
WW.Tour.Character.Title: Character Sheet
WW.Tour.Character.Content: Learn how to use everything the Player Character Sheet has to offer!
WW.Tour.Character.Intro.Title: Creating Player Characters
WW.Tour.Character.Intro.Content:
As a player or Sage, usually the very first thing you do is to attempt to create a new character, either to familiarize yourself with the game (or VTT system, such as this one) or to play a game that has already been set up.
This tour is going to run you through most of the features of the Character Sheet, meant for player characters.
WW.Tour.Character.Sheet.Title: Character Sheet
WW.Tour.Character.Sheet.Content:
Here is a character sheet example.
This digital sheet, like a pen and paper counterpart, is where you write all the information about a certain character meant to be controlled by a player.
WW.Tour.Character.Banner.Title: The Sheet's Banner
WW.Tour.Character.Banner.Content: This stylized banner offers a lot of basic information about the character in a fixed place, always shown on the sheet.
WW.Tour.Character.Nameplate.Title: The Name Plate
WW.Tour.Character.Nameplate.Content: This name plate is where a few main identification elements are displayed: the character's name, level, ancestry and novice path.
WW.Tour.Character.Circle.Title: The Portrait Circle
WW.Tour.Character.Circle.Content:
In this area, the character's portrait is surrounded by the each of the character's attributes.
You can click on the image to change it.
WW.Tour.Character.Attributes.Title: Attributes
WW.Tour.Character.Attributes.Content:
Each attribute has its name, the score and its modifier (signaled with + or -) displayed in inner circles.
You can click on the name or modifier to make an attribute roll!
WW.Tour.Character.ProfileMenu.Title: The Profile Menu
WW.Tour.Character.ProfileMenu.Content: If you hover the banner with your cursor, a menu is revealed at the top of the circle that can be used to see enlarged versions of the sheet's and prototype token's images, as well as having an option to show them to other users.
WW.Tour.Character.Luck.Title: Luck Roll
WW.Tour.Character.Luck.Content:
Hovering the banner also shows the Luck roll button.
Simply click on it to roll!
WW.Tour.Character.HealthBar.Title: Damage / Health Bar
WW.Tour.Character.HealthBar.Content: The Damage and Health bar displays all the useful information about a character's Damage Total and Health.
WW.Tour.Character.Health.Title: Health
WW.Tour.Character.Health.Content:
Your current Health is displayed here.
You can hover your current Health to see your normal Health score, any temporary Health bonuses and any Health lost.
WW.Tour.Character.Damage.Title: Damage
WW.Tour.Character.Damage.Content: Your Damage Total is displayed here.
WW.Tour.Character.HealthProgress.Title: Progress Bar
WW.Tour.Character.HealthProgress.Content: The progress bar fills according to how much Damage you have accumulated relative to your current Health.
WW.Tour.Character.HealthIndicator.Title: Health Indicator
WW.Tour.Character.HealthIndicator.Conten:
If you are Injured, Incapacitated or Dead, an indicator will show up here.
If you are Incapacitated, you can click on it to roll a d6 and determine how much Health you lost during the end of the round.
WW.Tour.Character.Stats.Title: Other Statistics
WW.Tour.Character.Stats.Content:
This section has the remaining main stats used by the game: Defense, Size, Speed and Bonus Damage.
Most of them are calculated automatically, so you cannot edit them here.
You can, however, hover them with your cursor to see more information about each individual stat.
WW.Tour.Character.EditMode.Title: Edit Mode
WW.Tour.Character.EditMode.Content: Sheets are always rendered in the read-only mode, as hinted by the padlock icon here. You can click on the Sheet Menu to toggle the edit mode on or off. A yellow unlocked padlock will be displayed when the sheet is in edit mode.
WW.Tour.Character.Tabs.Title: Sheet Tabs
WW.Tour.Character.Tabs.Content:
Right under the edit mode toggle button is the tab navigation section.
Here you can toggle between the Summary, Details, Equipment, Traits & Talents, Spells and Effects tabs by clicking on them.
WW.Tour.Character.Summary.Title: Summary Tab
WW.Tour.Character.Summary.Content:
The first and default opened tab is the Summary.
Here, you can find most information about a character condensed in a single space, similar to the statboxes used by the game.
The Summary was built with combat encounters in mind, so you'll rarely need to go to another tab while in combat.
However, many things that are displayed in the Summary are edited in another tab, as shown later in this tour.
The main purpose of the Summary tab is to display useful information, and not to edit them.
WW.Tour.Character.Ancestry.Title: Ancestry
WW.Tour.Character.Ancestry.Content:
Your character's Ancestry is displayed here.
Hover to edit it.
Alternatively, you can create Ancestries in a folder or Compendium, then drag and drop them on the sheet!
WW.Tour.Character.Paths.Title: Paths
WW.Tour.Character.Paths.Content:
You can edit your character Paths here.
Hover to edit them.
Alternatively, you can create Paths in a folder or Compendium, then drag and drop them on the sheet!
WW.Tour.Character.Level.Title: Level
WW.Tour.Character.Level.Content:
Your character's Level is displayed here.
Click to select your level.
WW.Tour.Character.SummaryStats.Title: Main Stats and Info
WW.Tour.Character.SummaryStats.Content:
Your main stats such as Size and Speed, as well as other basic information such as movement traits, professions and paths are shown here.
You can hover a field with your cursor to see more information, add or remove elements.
WW.Tour.Character.Attacks.Title: Attacks List
WW.Tour.Character.Attacks.Content: Your available attacks (often weapons) are found in this list of items, as well as your Bonus Damage if you have any.
WW.Tour.Character.AttackName.Title: Attack Name and Traits
WW.Tour.Character.AttackName.Content:
The name of the attack/weapon is displayed here. If the weapon has any traits, such as "Range" in this example, it's also displayed here.
You can left or right click the name for multiple actions:
● Peform the attack
● Select target and then attack
● Send the attack's description to chat
● Edit the attack
Note that you can always hover an entry to see the instructions for these actions.
WW.Tour.Character.AttackModifier.Title: Attribute Modifier and Boons/Banes
WW.Tour.Character.AttackModifier.Content:
This part indicates the attribute rolled by the weapon and its modifier.
If the weapon was set to roll with a number of boons or banes, it's also displayed here.
WW.Tour.Character.AttackDamage.Title: Attack Damage
WW.Tour.Character.AttackDamage.Content: The number or dice expression in the parenthesis indicates how much base damage the weapon deals before any extra damage is applied.
WW.Tour.Character.TalentsList.Title: Traits and Talents
WW.Tour.Character.TalentsList.Content:
This list shows all the creatures' Traits and Talents.
Like Attacks and Spells, you can click on their names to trigger one of the available functionalities.
If you chose to assign a trait or talent's type to "Action" or "Reaction", they will show here separately.
WW.Tour.Character.Uses.Title: Trait/Talent Uses or Tokens
WW.Tour.Character.Uses.Content:
Traits and talents that have uses or tokens have their uses/tokens represented by circles here.
You can click a an empty circle to spend an use, or a circle marked with a X to recover the use.
WW.Tour.Character.ToggleEffects.Title: Toggle Effects Button
WW.Tour.Character.ToggleEffects.Content:
Traits, talents and spells with Permanent Effects on them can be toggled on or off with this button.
Effects are explained in details in their dedicated tour.
WW.Tour.Character.Spell.Title: Spells
WW.Tour.Character.Spell.Content:
This list shows your discovered Traditions as well as the Spells you learned.
Like attacks, traits and talents, they have functionalities when their names are clicked.
In addition, each spell's castings are also tracked by circles.
WW.Tour.Character.Details.Title: Details Tab
WW.Tour.Character.Details.Content:
This tab is dedicated for detailed information about the character, such as appearance, background, identity or other relevant notes.
To edit a section, first toggle the Edit Mode, then on the icon that shows on the text area to enable the text editor.
Once you finish editing, remember to click on the save button to apply the changes.
WW.Tour.Character.Equipment.Title: Equipment Tab
WW.Tour.Character.Equipment.Content: The Equipment tab displays all the character's possessions, including coins, armor, weapons and other equipment.
WW.Tour.Character.Weapons.Title: Weapons List
WW.Tour.Character.Weapons.Content:
Your weapons are displayed here along with details about their Damage, Grip and Traits.
Like in the Summary, the weapon's name has the same click functionalities.
WW.Tour.Character.Coins.Title: Currency
WW.Tour.Character.Coins.Content:
Your coins used as currency are tracked here.
Gold coins (gp), silver coins (sp) and copper coins (cp) are displayed separately.
WW.Tour.Character.CarryingLimit.Title: Limite de Carga
WW.Tour.Character.CarryingLimit.Content:
Your carrying limit for equipment you carry is calculated and displayed here automatically.
The left side value is the total count of items, while the right side is your Strength score.
When you go above the limit, the text turns red.
WW.Tour.Character.Other.Title: Equipment List
WW.Tour.Character.Other.Content:
All your Equipment (except coins) are displayed in this list.
Uses/charges (if any) and item count are also tracked here.
WW.Tour.Character.Equip.Title: Toggle Equipment Effects
WW.Tour.Character.Equip.Content:
You can toggle an equipment's effects on the character by clicking on this button.
An equipped set of armor, for example, should have this toggled on.
WW.Tour.Character.Talents.Title: Traits and Talents Tab
WW.Tour.Character.Talents.Content:
Your traits and talents have a dedicated tab, with the similar functionalities of what was shown so far.
In addition, the source of the trait or talent is also displayed.
WW.Tour.Character.Spells.Title: Spells Tab
WW.Tour.Character.Spells.Content:
The spells tab lists your discovered traditions and learned spells.
Relevant information such as Tier, Tradition and Castings, are also displayed.
WW.Tour.Character.Effects.Title: Effects Tab
WW.Tour.Character.Effects.Content: The effects tab is where all effects relevant to the character are located, regardless if they are currently applied to them or not.
WW.Tour.Character.Afflictions.Title: Afflictions
WW.Tour.Character.Afflictions.Content:
Afflictions can be bestowed or removed here by clicking on their particular button.
Note that afflictions can also be bestowed or removed directly on the character's token by right clicking on it.
WW.Tour.Character.AfflictionsRemove.Cont: This powerful button can be used to remove all afflictions affecting the character at once.
WW.Tour.Character.EffectsAll.Title: All Effects
WW.Tour.Character.EffectsAll.Content: In this section, all effects related to the character (including afflictions) are listed, broken down in three categories: Temporary Effects, Permanent Effects and Inactive Effects.
WW.Tour.Character.EffectsTemporary.Title: Temporary Effects
WW.Tour.Character.EffectsTemporary.Conte: Ongoing Active Effects expected to be temporary because of a duration or because Luck ends it are grouped here.
WW.Tour.Character.EffectsPermanent.Title: Permanent Effects
WW.Tour.Character.EffectsPermanent.Conte: Active Effects without an expected duration or end are listed here.
WW.Tour.Character.EffectsInactive.Title: Inactive Effects
WW.Tour.Character.EffectsInactive.Conten: Effects currently not applied to the character but still tracked are listed here.
WW.Tour.NPC.Title: NPC Sheet
WW.Tour.NPC.Content: Learn how to use the NPC Sheet properly.
WW.Tour.NPC.Sheet.Title: NPC Sheet
WW.Tour.NPC.Sheet.Content: NPC sheets are more compact than character sheets, similar to the entries found in Secrets of the Weird Wizard's Bestiary. All information about a NPC can be stored in this sheet. If you haven't done the Character Sheet tour yet, we highly recommend you to start with it, as some common information will be skipped!
WW.Tour.NPC.Difficulty.Title: Difficulty
WW.Tour.NPC.Difficulty.Content: The header of the statbox emulates Bestiary entries: they display the creature's descriptors and difficulty.
WW.Tour.NPC.Banner.Title: The Sheet's Banner
WW.Tour.NPC.Banner.Content: Like in the Character sheet, the stylized banner on the summary offers many useful chunks of information about the NPC.
WW.Tour.NPC.Disposition.Title: NPC's Disposition
WW.Tour.NPC.Disposition.Content:
This plate shows the intended NPC disposition: Enemy or Ally.
Simply click on it to toggle between dispositions.
WW.Tour.NPC.ProfileMenu.Title: Profile Menu
WW.Tour.NPC.ProfileMenu.Content:
If you hover the banner with your cursor, the profile menu is revealed.
In addition to the regular functions of enlarging the profile and token images, you can also roll Luck from here.
WW.Tour.NPC.Defense.Title: Defense Badge
WW.Tour.NPC.Defense.Content:
For quick visibility, the NPC's total Defense is shown here next to the Damage / Health widget.
Hover the badge for detailed information about Defense.
WW.Tour.NPC.Health.Title: Damage and Health
WW.Tour.NPC.Health.Content:
The NPC's Damage total and current Health are displayed here, along with a progress bar.
For more information about Health or Damage or to edit them, hover them with your cursor.
WW.Tour.NPC.Stats.Title: Statistics and Common Traits
WW.Tour.NPC.Stats.Content: The NPC stats like Size and Speed, as well as any Special Movement Traits, Languages, Senses or Immunities are shown here. To edit these stats, you have to enable the edit mode and then edit it in the Summary Tab.
WW.Tour.NPC.Summary.Title: Summary Tab
WW.Tour.NPC.Summary.Content: Along with the banner, most of the information needed to use a NPC is found in the Summary Tab.
WW.Tour.NPC.Descriptors.Title: Descriptors
WW.Tour.NPC.Descriptors.Content:
The header here is reserved for the creature's descriptors.
Hover to edit it.
WW.Tour.NPC.Attributes.Title: Attributes
WW.Tour.NPC.Attributes.Content:
Each attribute name, score and modifier is found here in the header.
You can click on an attribute to roll it!
WW.Tour.NPC.Statbox.Title: Statbox Section
WW.Tour.NPC.Statbox.Content: The statbox section is where you can find all the remaining information you need to use NPCs during most of your games. In the edit mode, this is where you'll fill most of the NPC information as well.
WW.Tour.NPC.Talents.Title: Traits and Talents
WW.Tour.NPC.Talents.Content: This section lists all passive traits and talents the creature has.
WW.Tour.NPC.Buttons.Title: Functionality Buttons
WW.Tour.NPC.Buttons.Content: Like in the character sheet, NPCs also have buttons on item lists that allow you to do a plethora of things.
WW.Tour.NPC.Equipment.Title: Equipment Row
WW.Tour.NPC.Equipment.Content: If the NPC has an Equipment, such as an armor set or shield, it can be added to the Equipment row.
WW.Tour.NPC.Actions.Title: Actions
WW.Tour.NPC.Actions.Content: The NPC attacks, as well as any special action it might have, are displayed here.
WW.Tour.NPC.Attacks.Title: Attacks
WW.Tour.NPC.Attacks.Content: Attacks are formatted similar to the books and work exactly like weapons in the Character sheet.
WW.Tour.NPC.Reactions.Title: Reactions
WW.Tour.NPC.Reactions.Content: Special reactions that the NPC might use are here.
WW.Tour.NPC.End.Title: End of the Round Effects
WW.Tour.NPC.End.Content: Effects that trigger at the end of the round are shown here.
WW.Tour.NPC.Description.Title: Description Tab
WW.Tour.NPC.Description.Content: The Description tab is where you can store all the textual information about the NPC, be it from its Bestiary entry or something of your own.
WW.Tour.NPC.Effects.Title: Effects Tab
WW.Tour.NPC.Effects.Content:
The Effects tab is the same found in the Character sheet.
For more information about how to use it, see the Character Sheet and Effects tours.
QC.Menu.RoundHour: Round time to a full hour. Rounded up if half a hour already passed, or down if not.
QC.Settings.Label: Settings
QC.Settings.PreciseSkipHint: When enabled, tracks the exact amount of time passed. When disabled time segments (hours, days, weeks, months) are rounded to the next whole number.
QC.Settings.SkipRefHint: The time, in 24 hours format, used as reference when skipping days/weeks/months. The following day will start at the reference time.
QC.Settings.SunriseHint: The time, in 24 hours format, indicating when a sunrise happens.
QC.Settings.MiddayHint: The time, in 24 hours format, indicating when the sun is 90° towards the ground.
QC.Settings.SunsetHint: The time, in 24 hours format, indicating when a sunset happens.
QC.Settings.MidnightHint: The time, in 24 hours format, indicating when the sun is 90° towards the ground.
QC.Reset.Label: Reset
QC.Reset.Title: Reset tracking
QC.Reset.Msg: All tracked time will be reset. Once reset, the value cannot be restored by the application.
QC.Reset.Confirm: Are you sure you want to reset the tracker?
